title: Hardfought
data:
[Hardfought](https://www.hardfought.org/) is a NetHack community that offers [public servers](/wiki/Public_server "Public server"), similar to [NAO](/wiki/NAO "NAO").

Hardfought has its own IRC channel on Libera, [#hardfought](irc://irc.libera.chat/hardfought). This is also linked with the #nethack-hardfought channel on the [roguelikes Discord](https://discord.gg/dWMkgHn). The Beholder bot announces important events, deaths, and ascensions, and Pinobot can be used to find information on enemies across NetHack variants.

Like NAO, Hardfought has a config file editor on its website that allows you to copy and paste config files.

Hardfought provides hosting for major [tournaments](/wiki/Tournament "Tournament"). For [Junethack](/wiki/Junethack "Junethack"), most of the variants are hosted on Hardfought. [The November NetHack Tournament](/wiki/The_November_NetHack_Tournament "The November NetHack Tournament") is hosted on Hardfought.

## How to play on Hardfought

As of July 2024, Hardfought offers ssh access in three locations:

- <ssh://nethack@hardfought.org> -- United States (East Coast)
- <ssh://nethack@eu.hardfought.org> -- United Kingdom (London)
- <ssh://nethack@au.hardfought.org> -- Australia (Sydney)

You can also play in a browser:

- <https://www.hardfought.org/nethack/hterm/> -- web client, select a location
- <https://hardfought.org/hterm> -- direct link to United States (East Coast)
- <https://eu.hardfought.org/hterm> -- direct link to United Kingdom (London)
- <https://au.hardfought.org/hterm> -- direct link to Australia (Sydney)

As of Oct 12th 2018, you can connect to all Hardfought servers via IPv6 (ssh, https).

## Variants hosted

As of July 2024:

- [NetHack 1.3d](/wiki/NetHack_1.3d "NetHack 1.3d")
- [NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3"), HDF version - [github repository](https://github.com/NHTangles/NetHack/tree/hardfought)
- [NetHack 3.7.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.7.0 "NetHack 3.7.0"), HDF version, bleeding edge development version with public server based enhancements - [github repository](https://github.com/k21971/NetHack37)
- [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), 3.6.7 based variant
- [Hack'EM](/wiki/Hack%27EM "Hack'EM"), 3.6.7 based variant
- [SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack"), 3.7 based variant
- [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), 3.7 based variant
- [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack")
- [GruntHack](/wiki/GruntHack "GruntHack"), with bug fixes and UI enhancements
- [notdNetHack](/wiki/NotdNetHack "NotdNetHack")
- [notnotdNetHack](/wiki/NotnotdNetHack "NotnotdNetHack")
- [Slash'EM](/wiki/Slash%27EM "Slash'EM"), version 0.0.8E0F2, very recent updates as of Feb 2024 (bug fixes and some quality of life enhancements) - [github repository](https://github.com/k21971/SlashEM)
- [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM")
- [SporkHack](/wiki/SporkHack "SporkHack"), with bug fixes and UI enhancements
- [UnNetHack](/wiki/UnNetHack "UnNetHack")
- [DynaHack](/wiki/DynaHack "DynaHack")
- [FIQhack](/wiki/FIQhack "FIQhack")
- [NetHack 4](/wiki/NetHack_4 "NetHack 4")
- [NetHack Fourk](/wiki/NetHack_Fourk "NetHack Fourk")
- [AceHack](/wiki/AceHack "AceHack")
- [GnollHack](/wiki/GnollHack "GnollHack")
- [ZapM](/wiki/ZAPM "ZAPM"), not strictly a NetHack variant; this is not listed in the menu due to a lack of free space, but can still be selected with z
